ECONOMICS, COMMERCE abbreviation for consumer price index: a list of the prices of basic goods and services, showing how they change each month. The CPI is usually used to measure inflation: About 55% of the CPI measures the cost of services, ranging from health care to airline fares. Compare
cost of living index
retail price index
